p: Female Ae. aegypti relative abundance was estimated in the LRGV and the city of Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, using AGO traps that were deployed concurrently on both sides of the border in 2017 ( Figure 1). Eighty AGO traps were deployed outside residential homes in Reynosa and checked weekly between May 7 and Aug 12 (trapping data were unavailable for two weeks in this period due to adverse weather or trap failure) [ 32]. In the LRGV, 30 AGO traps were deployed outside residential homes during the same weeks as a subset of the data presented in a previous study [ 14].
